intro: Aleuritia, commonly known as the elderberry, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Adoxaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Aleuritia umbellata, which is native to East Asia. The plants are shrubs or small trees characterized by their clusters of small, white or greenish flowers. They produce berries that range in color from white to black, depending on the species and maturity. These berries are often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications.
